snippet: Adam Stuart Busby, 64, was charged with making 17 e-mailed threats to the University of Pittsburgh in April and bomb threats to federal courthouses in Pittsburgh, Erie and Johnstown in June.
abstract: Adam Stuart Busby, who prosecutors say was a founding member of a Scottish terrorist group, is indicted on Wednesday on charges he e-mailed bomb threats that disrupted campus life at the University of Pittsburgh; Busby is in custody in Ireland.
lead_paragraph: Adam Stuart Busby, 64, was charged with making 17 e-mailed threats to the University of Pittsburgh in April and bomb threats to federal courthouses in Pittsburgh, Erie and Johnstown in June.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Suspect in Ireland Charged in Pittsburgh Bomb Threats
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Suspect In Ireland Charged In Pittsburgh Bomb Threats
